H0.text: The skeletal system is the system most responsible for transporting blood throughout the body.

H1.text: The excretory system is the system most responsible for transporting blood throughout the body.

H2.text: Digestive system is the system most responsible for transporting blood throughout the body.

H3.text: The circulatory system is most responsible for transporting blood throughout the body.

A4.text: The circulatory system is closed in vertebrates, meaning that the blood is contained within the vascular network.

A5.text: Blood is a fluid consisting of plasma, red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets; it is circulated around the body carrying oxygen and nutrients to the tissues and collecting and disposing of waste materials.
